version_description: -Fixes some situations where the app would crash because folders or albums contain broken special characters
-Fixes some situations where the app would crash because folders or albums contain broken special characters
Bug fixes
Bug fixes
Now you can upload photos and videos.  Backup everything!
Now you can upload photos and videos.  Backup everything!

Now you can upload photos to your SmugMug galleries directly from your camera roll and other apps!
Enable the SmugMug extension on your iOS device and begin uploading photos from your Camera Roll, from SMS messages, and any other apps that allow developer extensions.  More info at http://smu.gs/1BBfv2n

Now you can upload photos to your SmugMug galleries directly from your camera roll and other apps!
Enable the SmugMug extension on your iOS device and begin uploading photos from your Camera Roll, from SMS messages, and any other apps that allow developer extensions.  More info at http://smu.gs/1BBfv2n

Photos privately shared with you now show up when you’re logged in. Look for the shiny new “Shared with Me” section on the app’s home screen. Give your mom, dad, and grandparents secure access with their own free Guest Accounts. Or share things instantly and securely with your client after an event

Photos privately shared with you now show up when you’re logged in. Look for the shiny new “Shared with Me” section on the app’s home screen. Give your mom, dad, and grandparents secure access with their own free Guest Accounts. Or share things instantly and securely with your client after an event
Fixed a problem where videos could not be played on some devices.
Fixed a problem where videos could not be played on some devices.
Uh, we had a slight app malfunction that caused some people from seeing their images, but uh... everything's perfectly all right now. We're fine. We're all fine here now, thank you. How are you?
Uh, we had a slight app malfunction that caused some people from seeing their images, but uh... everything's perfectly all right now. We're fine. We're all fine here now, thank you. How are you?

We busted out our paintbrushes and t-squares and made some user interface improvements — hopefully you won’t even notice (it was more like “a little off the top” than a full on glamor shot makeover).

We noticed some photos were being pokey while loading (and no one likes pokey photos), so we’re pre-caching images in lightbox. Now your images will load faster and furious when scrolling to the next index.

We ratcheted up downloading in a big way. See if you can follow our flow—by prioritizing the downloading of display content before the downloading offline content, specifically videos, this app can now make the Kessel Run in less than 12 parsecs.   

We sprayed for some bugs that were creeping behind the walls and watched with glee as they took their last breath.

We busted out our paintbrushes and t-squares and made some user interface improvements — hopefully you won’t even notice (it was more like “a little off the top” than a full on glamor shot makeover).

We noticed some photos were being pokey while loading (and no one likes pokey photos), so we’re pre-caching images in lightbox. Now your images will load faster and furious when scrolling to the next index.

We ratcheted up downloading in a big way. See if you can follow our flow—by prioritizing the downloading of display content before the downloading offline content, specifically videos, this app can now make the Kessel Run in less than 12 parsecs.   

We sprayed for some bugs that were creeping behind the walls and watched with glee as they took their last breath.

If you’re still using passwords like “123456” or “Password” we have one word for you, “REALLY!” Actually two words “STOP NOW!!” It’s 2016 people and the hackers are everywhere. It’s time to protect all your online accounts with the FBI-proof, Mission Impossible style, 256-bit AES encryption of 1Password—which we are excited to announce, is now supported on our SmugMug apps.

If you’re still using passwords like “123456” or “Password” we have one word for you, “REALLY!” Actually two words “STOP NOW!!” It’s 2016 people and the hackers are everywhere. It’s time to protect all your online accounts with the FBI-proof, Mission Impossible style, 256-bit AES encryption of 1Password—which we are excited to announce, is now supported on our SmugMug apps.
We noticed that some photos, in rare occasions, were being naughty and failing to upload. We gave them a time-out and now they are all on their best behavior, uploading like champs.
We noticed that some photos, in rare occasions, were being naughty and failing to upload. We gave them a time-out and now they are all on their best behavior, uploading like champs.

Uploading—better, faster, stronger, (and more organized!) 

• Now you can see the status of each photo in a handy dandy upload queue, including the ones started in the share extension. All aboard the upload train! Choo Choo! 
• We also added concurrent uploading so your uploads upload faster. (If you say upload enough times it gets weird TBH) 
• Now you can upload multiple galleries at once. Moreover, you can queue up more uploads while you’re already uploading. It’s like an uploading bonanza in this app.
• We also powered up some secret background stuff to make uploading stronger and even more reliable.

Uploading—better, faster, stronger, (and more organized!) 

• Now you can see the status of each photo in a handy dandy upload queue, including the ones started in the share extension. All aboard the upload train! Choo Choo! 
• We also added concurrent uploading so your uploads upload faster. (If you say upload enough times it gets weird TBH) 
• Now you can upload multiple galleries at once. Moreover, you can queue up more uploads while you’re already uploading. It’s like an uploading bonanza in this app.
• We also powered up some secret background stuff to make uploading stronger and even more reliable.

With photos, size totally matters, and the app now includes support for our new larger sizes. That means your photos will look even more crystal clear on the jumbo iPhone 7+, all the way through the colossal iPad Pro. 

We also fixed a rare bug that scrambled up the order of your gallery photos like a sticky-fingered toddler mixes up a puzzle. Your photos now sort properly.

With photos, size totally matters, and the app now includes support for our new larger sizes. That means your photos will look even more crystal clear on the jumbo iPhone 7+, all the way through the colossal iPad Pro. 

We also fixed a rare bug that scrambled up the order of your gallery photos like a sticky-fingered toddler mixes up a puzzle. Your photos now sort properly.
Fixed a bug with the share extension.
Fixed a bug with the share extension.

Update news: 
• Seeing double? Not anymore. We now save you from accidentally uploading duplicate images to the same gallery.

Update news: 
• Seeing double? Not anymore. We now save you from accidentally uploading duplicate images to the same gallery.

Fixed an issue that prevented users from uploading photos directly from the Messages app.
Squashed some bugs that were causing crashes for a small number of users.

Fixed an issue that prevented users from uploading photos directly from the Messages app.
Squashed some bugs that were causing crashes for a small number of users.

We were getting reports that some slo-mo video uploads were a no-go. Slo-mo ninja cat video fans seemed the most upset. Now all your slo-mo videos are good-to-go. (Side note: we are not able to check for duplicate uploading of slo-mo videos yet…stay tuned.)

If you've ever uploaded a real biggy of a file to your account and wondered—is it there yet?...is it there yet?...is it there yet?— wonder no more. We've added a handy-dandy indicator to let you know the status of your file.

We were getting reports that some slo-mo video uploads were a no-go. Slo-mo ninja cat video fans seemed the most upset. Now all your slo-mo videos are good-to-go. (Side note: we are not able to check for duplicate uploading of slo-mo videos yet…stay tuned.)

If you've ever uploaded a real biggy of a file to your account and wondered—is it there yet?...is it there yet?...is it there yet?— wonder no more. We've added a handy-dandy indicator to let you know the status of your file.

It’s summertime and we got the mighty bug-zapper out of winter storage. Have a look at all the pesky creatures our mighty iOS engineers sent to the grave. 
 
1. If you were getting errors when downloading your own photos, well, we just made downloading an error-free zone. 
 
2. And speaking of downloads — account owners will now download their original photos, not lower-rez copies. Plus, they also will get non-watermarked versions of their photos.
 
3. The app now honors the “Download Buttons” settings for every gallery. The “Save to Camera Roll” button will only be available to visitors if the “Download Buttons” setting is ON. Owners can always download their own photos. 
 
4. Sharing to Instagram just got an upgrade. Previously you could only give your photo a caption. Now you can add filters, crop the photo, tag friends, add geolocation, and more.
 
5. Now hear this!! If your device’s ringer was set to Silenced mode, video audio wouldn’t play. Now it does.
 
6. There were some readability issues when sharing photos via Messages or Email. Not any more!
 
7. You’ll now see a warning when logging out of the app, letting you know that your account info and offline content will be lost (removed). 
 
8. We fixed an issue where videos wouldn’t play if some non-standard characters were in the Gallery Name.
 
9. In rare cases, some photos wouldn’t load because of a device Date/Time settings issue. Now photos load regardless of clock settings.
 
10. In rare cases, some customers were stuck in an endless loop of spinning squares. Since hypnotism is not one of our core offerings we decided to end that in favor of beautiful photos and galleries.

Fixes an issue where upgrading from a previous version would cause the app to freeze. We're still working through an issue some of you are experiencing with spinning squares - stay tuned.

We are so sorry for our last attempt at squashing summertime bugs. When we turned on our bug zapper recently, we were suddenly overwhelmed by the pesky creatures and quickly realized a bigger, better, more intense zapper was required to take care of all the bugginess. 

Check out everything we squashed with our latest ZAP!

1. If you were getting errors when downloading your own photos, well, we just made downloading an error-free zone. 

2. And speaking of downloads — account owners will now download their original photos, not lower-rez copies. Plus, they also will get non-watermarked versions of their photos. 

3. The app now honors the “Download Buttons” settings for every gallery. The “Save to Camera Roll” button will only be available to visitors if the “Download Buttons” setting is ON. Owners can always download their own photos. 

4. Sharing to Instagram just got an upgrade. Previously you could only give your photo a caption. Now you can add filters, crop the photo, tag friends, add geolocation, and more.

5. Now hear this!! If your device’s ringer was set to Silenced mode, video audio wouldn’t play. Now it does.

6. There were some readability issues when sharing photos via Messages or Email. Not any more!

7. You’ll now see a warning when logging out of the app, letting you know that your account info and offline content will be lost (removed). 

8. We fixed an issue where videos wouldn’t play if some non-standard characters were in the Gallery Name.

9. In rare cases, some photos wouldn’t load because of a device Date/Time settings issue. Now photos load regardless of clock settings.

10. Also in rare cases, some customers were stuck in an endless loop of spinning squares. Since hypnotism is not one of our core offerings we decided to end that in favor of beautiful photos and galleries.

We are so sorry for our last attempt at squashing summertime bugs. When we turned on our bug zapper recently, we were suddenly overwhelmed by the pesky creatures and quickly realized a bigger, better, more intense zapper was required to take care of all the bugginess. 

Check out everything we squashed with our latest ZAP!

1. If you were getting errors when downloading your own photos, well, we just made downloading an error-free zone. 

2. And speaking of downloads — account owners will now download their original photos, not lower-rez copies. Plus, they also will get non-watermarked versions of their photos. 

3. The app now honors the “Download Buttons” settings for every gallery. The “Save to Camera Roll” button will only be available to visitors if the “Download Buttons” setting is ON. Owners can always download their own photos. 

4. Sharing to Instagram just got an upgrade. Previously you could only give your photo a caption. Now you can add filters, crop the photo, tag friends, add geolocation, and more.

5. Now hear this!! If your device’s ringer was set to Silenced mode, video audio wouldn’t play. Now it does.

6. There were some readability issues when sharing photos via Messages or Email. Not any more!

7. You’ll now see a warning when logging out of the app, letting you know that your account info and offline content will be lost (removed).

10. Also in rare cases, some customers were stuck in an endless loop of spinning squares. Since hypnotism is not one of our core offerings we decided to end that in favor of beautiful photos and galleries.
Support for uploading photos taken in Apple's new HEIF format in iOS 11.
Support for uploading photos taken in Apple's new HEIF format in iOS 11.

- NEW: Edit Folder and Gallery Settings
- NEW: View Photo Metadata
- NEW: Updated for iOS 11 Compatibility
- FIXED: Launching the app in landscape orientation

With this update we’re adding some functionality to your fabulous folders and gorgeous galleries. You can now edit their Name, Description, Keywords, and set their Visibility (Public, Unlisted, Private) and Access (password protection only) settings. To edit the settings just tap the “Edit” button at the top of any gallery or folder.

Also, you now have the ability to view a photos metadata ... things like: camera, aperture, shutter speed, ISO and more. Just open a photo and tap the info button.  

And finally, we squashed a bug that was showing up when the app was launched in landscape orientation.

With this update we’re adding some functionality to your fabulous folders and gorgeous galleries. You can now edit their Name, Description, Keywords, and set their Visibility (Public, Unlisted, Private) and Access (password protection only) settings. To edit the settings just tap the “Edit” button at the top of any gallery or folder.

Also, you now have the ability to view a photos metadata ... things like: camera, aperture, shutter speed, ISO and more. Just open a photo and tap the info button.  

And finally, we squashed a bug that was showing up when the app was launched in landscape orientation.

In this latest release you’ll find:
* Optimizations all across the app
* Bug fixes

You asked, we listened! We’ve made TONS of optimizations all across the app. And, of course, we’ve been squashing any bugs that have been creeping around. Also, stay tuned for our next update, which features full optimization for the iPhone X! Coming (VERY) soon!

* Bug fixes

In this latest release you’ll find:
* Optimization for iPhone X
* Bug fixes

To celebrate the release of the iPhone X, we’ve updated our app so your SmugMug photos are fully optimized for the fancy new flagship model. We’ve also made lots of optimizations for all the other iPhones. And, of course, we’ve been squashing any bugs that have been creeping around.

* Bug fixes

Bug Fixes and optimizations. Keep the great feedback and reviews coming!
Bug Fixes and optimizations. Keep the great feedback and reviews coming!

Hey Smuggers! This update is brought to you by the word convenience. 
- Upload multiple photos more easily thanks to better organization, group selection, and the ability to see full-sized images. (So convenient!) 
- Bug Fixes and optimizations. 

For those experience frustrating upload crashes - they should mostly be gone. Let us know if you still experience any of them so we can get rid of any lingering issues.

This update introduces some game-changing new features (Hello, Add Button!) perfect for all you SmugMuggers who like convenience. 

New features: 
Try out the new Add Button to create folders and galleries from your phone. 
Upload all the photos you want at once: just tap and drag to select multiple photos with ease. 

Bug fixes: 
Save photos to your Camera Roll without that pesky error that was plaguing some users.  
Feast your eyes on our new fixes for a select few layouts that were wonky on the iPhone X. 
Enjoy general performance improvements.

Your search woes are over - at least on the SmugMug app (we can’t help you find your missing socks)! Now you can search for photos, videos, galleries, and folders right from the comfort of your iOS device.

Easy navigation, no compass needed. With all our recent updates and feature releases, we thought we’d simplify our in-app navigation. Just look for the "•••" menu to find settings, photo info, and actions even easier.

Our newest iOS drop puts more power in your taps. Now you’ll be able to select multiple photos to download straight to your iOS device. When viewing photos in a gallery, look for the option to select multiple photos in the overflow menu or long-press on a photo to begin selecting multiple photos.

We also added full support for the two newest iPad Pro sizes so your photos will look pristine on your favorite tablet.

We have a very “moving” update for you today. You can now move your photos and videos and collect virtual copies of them from the convenience of your phone. Want more? You can also delete and share multiple photos at once. Please keep the feedback and reviews coming.

Fixed an issue with uploading from other apps.

This release has some new goodies plus some improvements:

1) Visitors can now download photos from galleries protected with a download password, as long as they have the correct password.
2) Added an option for sharing to Instagram that allows you to filter, tag and caption your photos before posting. Just look for "Copy to Instagram".
3) Fixed an uploading issue.

3) Fixed an uploading issue.

Bug fixes to make you and your photos happy.
Bug fixes to make you and your photos happy.

New or updated in this version:
1) You can now change whether photos can be downloaded by your visitors, and can even require a password to download (visit "Gallery Settings" to do so). 
2) Support for iOS 13
3) Bug fixes and performance enhancements

1) You can now change whether photos can be downloaded by your visitors, and can even require a password to download (visit "Gallery Settings" to do so). 
2) Support for iOS 13
3) Bug fixes and performance enhancements
This release comes with a number of fixes to keep you and your photos happy.
This release comes with a number of fixes to keep you and your photos happy.

Keep every single one of your photos safe, forever. Auto-Upload will automatically upload your phone and tablet photos to SmugMug — just tap the gear icon to enable it today. The app organizes them by date but you can always reorganize them by moving and collecting to galleries of your choosing. Photos uploaded by auto-upload are always private by default.

For best performance leave the app running until the initial auto-upload is complete. New photos will automatically upload in the background. 

We also squashed a few bugs while we were at it.

We also squashed a few bugs while we were at it.

- Squashed a few bugs
- Galleries created within the app will use the settings from your "Default Preset". Log in to SmugMug on a computer and set your default preset settings in "Account Settings".
- Automatically upload all your photos to SmugMug. (Auto-Upload requires iOS13)
Keep every single one of your photos safe, forever. Auto-Upload will automatically upload your phone and tablet photos to SmugMug — just tap the gear icon to enable it today. The app organizes them by date but you can always reorganize them by moving and collecting to galleries of your choosing. Photos uploaded by auto-upload are always private by default.
For best performance leave the app running until the initial auto-upload is complete. New photos will automatically upload in the background.

- Squashed a few bugs
- Galleries created within the app will use the settings from your "Default Preset". Log in to SmugMug on a computer and set your default preset settings in "Account Settings".

Recent updates to improve your experience!
- Notifications letting you know how many new photos were auto-uploaded each week.

- Save entire galleries to your device photo gallery.
- Edit more gallery settings directly from the app.

- Long press to drag/drop to reorder photos and galleries.
- Galleries now automatically use settings from your "Default Preset".
